intro: Dipteranthus obliquus, commonly known as the oblique dipteranthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Dipteranthus obliquus is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
